sec.p: Nestling mass was significantly higher in the reduced treatment compared with the control group (β = 1.20, t = 3.7, df = 35, P = 0.001, Fig. 2), and varied positively with tarsus length (β = 1.04, t = 11.5, df = 95, P<0.001). We did not find evidence for a relationship between nestling mass with either timing of nesting (β = −0.01, t = −1.0, df = 35, P = 0.321) or year (2010: β = 0.16, t = 0.51, df = 35, P = 0.616).

div.div: Box plot illustrating lower nestling mass (g) for control broods (4 fledglings) relative to experimentally reduced broods (3 fledglings).
div.p: Solid circles in the middle of each box represent median values, the boxes encompass the inter-quantile range (25–75%), and the whiskers and hollow points represent the outer 25% quantiles.
